channel.title: Repeat until...?
channel.description:
How can i put 2 until exceptions in a loop.
For example...
Repeat This Until(this) or (that)
Something like that :S How would i code the untils?

item.title: Repeat until...?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You can also use “and”, to make it work on that example, change “until (i = 5) or (e = 30);” to “until (i >= 5) and (e >= 30);”.

I added > in front of the =, this means “more, or equal to”, so if i is more, or equal to 5, and e is more, or equal to 30, then it will finish the loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat until...?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“m0ng00se, post:1, topic:187063”]How can i put 2 until exceptions in a loop.

For example…

Repeat
This
Until(this) or (that)

Something like that :S How would i code the untils?[/quote]

Well the example you gave will work as you hope it would work.

var
i, e : Integer;

begin
repeat
inc(i); //Increase i by 1
incEx(e, 10);
writeln(inttostr(i));
writeln(inttostr(e));
until (i = 5) or (e = 30);
writeln(‘yay’);
end.

Output -
Successfully compiled
1
10
2
20
3
30
yay
Successfully executed

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat until...?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Then something like this:

bool : boolean;

procedure istrue;
begin
if condition1
bool = true
if condition 2
bool = true
end;

item.title: Repeat until...?
item.dc:creator: @m0ng00se m0ng00se
item.description:
@m0ng00se wrote:

But i dont want it to wait for both to be true, im using the 2nd one as a backup so that the loop wont run forever if the first condition never becomes true.

Read full topic

item.title: Repeat until...?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The only way I know is make a procedure with a boolean, but this probably is too farfetched, like:

bool : boolean;

procedure istrue;
a, b : integer bool : boolean;
begin
if condition1
a = 1;
if condition2
b = 1;
if a + b = 2
boolean = true;

and then

repeat
this
Until (bool = true);

Read full topic
